Package assignment1

Class MyHealthData

java.lang.Object
assignment1.MyHealthDataBase
assignment1.MyHealthData
public class MyHealthData extends MyHealthDataBase
This class represents a system that maintains important health information about a patient. This MyHealthData class extends the MyHealthDataBase superclass, in order to use the calculateBMI() method.

  • Constructor Details

    • MyHealthData

      public MyHealthData(String firstName, String lastName, String gender, double height, double weight, int birthYear, int currentYear)
      This constructor creates a 'MyHealthData' object with the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      firstName - - this will hold a String value of the patients first name.
      lastName - - this will hold a String value of the patients last name.
      gender - - this will hold a String value of the patients gender.
      height - - this will hold a double value of the patients height.
      weight - - this will hold a double value of the patients weight.
      birthYear - - this will hold an integer value of the year the patient was born.
      currentYear - - this will hold an integer value of the year the current year. This constructor allows the storage of a patients information, in the form of the listed parameters. This will allow the creation of a report specific to a patient.

  • Method Details

    • setFirstName

      public void setFirstName(String firstName)
      This method is used to store a string value as the firstName variable. This will be used in the test class, where a user will enter a String as a first name and it will be stored.
      Parameters:
      firstName - - the first name of the patient.

      public double getWeight()
      This method returns the current stored value of the weight double variable.

      weight - the weight of the patient.

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      This method is used to find the patients age. This is done by subtracting the year the patient was born, from the current year. This is done by using the getCurrentYear() and getBirthYear() methods. This is done to complete the different methods for patients heart rates later, using the patients age in the methods equations.
      Returns:
      age - the patients current age stored in an integer variable.

    • getMaxHeartRate

      public int getMaxHeartRate()
      This method calculates the patients maximum heart rate. This is done by using the equation [maxHeartRate = (220 - age)], subtracting the patients age (using getAge() method) from the constant 220.
      Returns:
      maxHeartRate - the patients maximum heart rate, stored as an integer variable.

    • getMinTargetRate

      public double getMinTargetRate()
      this method calculates the patients minimum target heart rate. this is done by using the equation [minimum target heart rate = maxHeartRate / 2], dividing the current patients maximum heart rate, stored as double maxHeartRate, by 2.
      Returns:
      minTargetRate - the patients minimum target heart rate, stored as a double variable.

    • getMaxTargetRate

      public double getMaxTargetRate()
      This method calculates the patients maximum target heart rate. This is done by using the equation [maximum target heart rate = (maxHeartRate * 0.85)], multiplying the current patients maximum heart rate, stored as double maxHeartRate, by 0.85.
      Returns:
      maxTargetRate - the patients maximum target heart rate, stored as an integer variable.

    • displayMyHealthData

      public void displayMyHealthData()
      This method is used to create a final report of the patients information. The method will use all of the get/set methods within the program to retrieve stored values of a patient and will display the values into the console.
